description: Whoa (c. 1843) is a variant of woa (c. 1840), itself a variant of wo (c. 1787), from who (c. 1450), ultimately from Middle English ho, hoo (interjection), probably from Old Norse hó! (interjection, also, a shepherd's call). Compare German ho, Old French ho ! (“hold!, halt!”).

verbs.description: whoa (third-person singular simple present whoas, present participle whoaing, simple past and past participle whoaed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To attempt to slow (an animal) by crying "whoa".
examples: He was whoaing the horses loudly, and they did seem to be going faster than usual—in fact, they were galloping.
